metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45444 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In zsh before 5.8.1, an attacker can achieve code execution if they control a command output inside the prompt, as demonstrated by a %F argument. This occurs because of recursive PROMPT_SUBST expansion.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zsh - 5.8-3ubuntu1.1
zsh-common - 5.8-3ubuntu1.1
zsh-static - 5.8-3ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> The commits fdb8b0ce and bdc4d70a are related to a partial commit that can be used in case an user can't update to a patched version that contains c187154f commit.

criterions.comment: zsh package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8-3ubuntu1.1').
